content: I recommend this for parents and for teachers. It develops great intuition for geometric properties and logic, appropriate for kids and adults. I recommend it to my community college geometry students, and my 3-year-old also loves it. How's that for range? (To be honest, my 3-year-old will get more out of it when he gets a little more dextrous. It's probably more appropriate for 5+) Update: My child is 7 now, and he still plays it occasionally. He's definitely more tuned in to what he's doing as he plays, and he's using the language that the app introduces. This makes me wish they had introduced a little more vocabulary, for example "parallel". He could tell me all about wings, and he knows the word parallel from other contexts, I just sort of wish the app would reinforce the use of the word. Overall, though, I still love it.
replyContent: Hi Kendra Thank you for a fantastic review, and for recommending the game to other parents and teachers. Happy to hear that your child appreciates the game, and about your thoughts on developing the vocabulary. This will help us continue to develop the product in the future. Good luck with the practice! Regards, DragonBox Support

content: I'm playing through Bluestacks on a PC. So the 'zoom in by pinching' is more coordination than a small child can handle on a trackpad. The game 'works' seamlessly in Bluestacks - congratulations. But if you will be playing this without a proper touchscreen, I don't recommend it. If I had an easy touchscreen solution, I would definitely be reinstalling this - I've been really impressed by the Algebra apps (those do work better on a PC). Difficulty setting is a good feature :)
This app was supposed to be about the periodic table of elements but it has different kinds of triangles and squares

My last review says that it's broken and was stuck at the orange screen, but now it works after the recent update. Also, got an email from support after 2 days of reporting the issue. Thank you so much for fixing this. I've updated my rating to 5 stars!
replyContent:
Hei hei,

Thank you for your review. There was a bug that caused this that has since been fixed. If you still have problems, please contact us at support@dragonbox.com, and we will be more than happy to try and help you resolve your issues. 

Regards

content: The app is great...when it works. I've been trying to open it up since yesterday, but I don't get past the orange screen. All the other DragonBox app I have work fine, this one however just won't boot up.
App opens to an orange screen, then freezes. Attempted to open multiple times with same result. Uninstalled and reinstalled the app and had same result with frozen orange screen.
replyContent: Hi Lisa. Thanks for your review. We would love to see if we can help you out. Could you contact us through support@dragonbox.com and give us a few more details about the issue. Love from the DragonBox team.

content: Nice job, dragonbox! You've really scored big with this! The only problem is that it's a little laggy going from the game to the title screen, but other than that, great job!
I love this game! #BestMathGameComanyEver!
replyContent: Thank you Emma!

content: Wonderful math content with intriguing graphics. But it would be nice to see the battle sequences incorporate some of the Geometry content.
Great application, only one question,any plans on adding Serbian language as you have in dragon box algebra?
what a great way to introduce a student to proofs!!!
this is a great game
replyContent: Thank you so much for your feedback, it means a lot!

content: Wow!
replyContent: We do love to "Wow" our users :-)! Thank you so much for your feedback

content: Awesome
replyContent: Thank you for your appreciation, we aim to please!

content: The concept is great. It's a really cool layout and fun. We have some big complaints though. When in the advanced levels, it's virtually impossible to click the angles and sides because there are so many monster icons on top of each other. Also, when you finish the game, nothing happens. It does even say woohoo or congratulations. We had to go back to the tower. And all this while we were ramping up and trying to get as many monsters as possible in order to fight the dragon... Quite the let down
replyContent: Thank you for your appreciation. To click on the angles in the advanced levels, zooming in and out really helps. Regarding the lack of a big happening at the end of the game, our primary focus is always on the learning features. We will take your relevant feedback under advise when planning our next update. Thank you for helping us to do better!

content: Great educational game. Well worth the cost.
Great introduction to core geometry concepts
Great value for money. Quite challenging but kids seem to be able to understand it!
Great app! Would love another level adding more concepts and more difficult problems.
Fantastic, great way to teach geometry concepts. My kids love it. Great quality and no ads.
Greatest urgently required to pay for the camping trip and avoid Oslo area to be getting a few days to pay for it last year
Son loves it. So do I.
My daughter loves this app, but makes me do the 'fighting' parts.
Makes geometry fun! Entertaining for adults and kids. My 2nd grader enjoys playing on his own, and my preschooler likes playing with a few hints from us.
An excellent game that helps teach geometry in a very fun way.

We have loved Dragonbox and Numbers, so were excited to buy another app fron this company. Unfortunately, this app isn't anywhere near as intuitive as the others, and in fact, is very difficult to understand -- and thus actually play -- as a result. I am very disappointed.
Teaches the essentials of geometry proofs in an intuitive and natural way.  My kids loved it.

I was hoping that this app would teach the rules of geometry in the same way that DragonBox Algebra teaches how to manipulate algebraic formulas.  Unfortunately, there's no actual construction of diagrams, only reasoning about diagrams that are already drawn up.  It's OK as far as it goes, and might make an amusing game for kids, but doesn't capture much of what's taught in a geometry class.
replyContent: Mike, thanks for your feedback. Sorry to disappoint you! Elements is not a construction game and wasn't advertised as such. As said in its description it captures the part of geometry that is taught in middle and high school, made available for younger minds. Of course kids should explore geometry by constructing things. We might tackle that later!

content: I got seriously into this and couldn't put it down until I finished it. Oh, and the children like it too ðŸ˜€
replyContent: Hahaha Thanks Deryk. Glad you liked you too!

content: In between stages, there is a lightsaber-like sound that plays even if sound and music have both been set to 0. Please fix.
replyContent: Hello Loren. This will be fixed in the next release. Thanks for reporting it!

content: one of the best educational apps I've found
replyContent: Thanks Yaik!

content: Essential for children and adults
It would be nice if there was another level at the end.  You spend the whole game learning the concepts.  There should be more of an opportunity at the end to practice applying those concepts.

On my Samsung Tab S, it worked one or two times. Then it stopped working. When I wrote to support, I only got an automated response. It seems that they respond better here. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling several times. If nothing else, I expected some response from support.  [ U P D A T E ] The latest update yesterday or today seems to have fixed the issue. I am still bummed that I didn't get a response for so long - just an acknowledgment of my issue would have been sufficient. But for this customer service issue, I would rate it as 5 stars. [U P D A T E] They went ahead and refunded me to make up for the previous customer service issue. Restoring the 5th star for that.
replyContent: Hello Pawan, thanks you very much to have updated your review. Really sorry about being late. We are a small company. We receive support request through many channels (emails, facebook, the different stores...) and sometimes we miss one or two, especially during the summer, when people are in holidays. Take contact by email for a little gift! :)

content: Not quite as intuitive as dragon box but she still has a ton of fun and it does a great job simplifying complex topics
replyContent: Hello Tomas! Thanks for giving us some feedback! Maybe you could tell us which area of the game could be improved for better intuitiveness in your mind? Thanks!

content: Update has fixed any issues.
replyContent: Hello Matthew. Our underlying game engine (unity3d) has some issues with some devices it seems. We've updated our game with a newer engine version a few days ago. Have you tried the latest version of Elements ? If the problem is fixed, please update your review. Otherwise please take contact with our support ! Thanks!

content: The game over always great for learning but could have used more shapes, such as Pentagons and hexagons.
replyContent: Hello Melissa, the game is about geometry proof, following the path of Euclid's Elements. While pentagons and hexagons are interesting geometry shapes, they do not bring too much to the topic of making logic proofs. If we had to add more content to this game, it would probably be things like identical triangles or similar. Thanks for your feedback!

content: My kids really enjoyed this game.  Suggestion, could there be a switch to flip between modes: one where  a bonus is received for 100% identification of all shapes, angles, and other geometry features and one for the minimalist solution.

The company behind The Dragonbox series has once again proven it's ability to "trick" you into learning concepts. Can't wait to get home from vacation and apply the knowledge my kids built up to paper, pencil, ruler and compass (and geogebra ;) )
Please either make the app work or refund the money.  Raised a refund request but no response despite sending reminders. I will now have to raise a dispute with my bank
replyContent: Hello Chandra, support got a bit stale because of holidays. We've refunded you a few weeks ago. As for the bug, we've updated our game with a newer engine version a few days ago. Have you tried the latest version of Elements ? We would be happy if you could update your review. Thanks!

content: These "games" are stellar. Best value for money I've seen in a *long* while for Android apps. PLEASE MAKE MORE. ALREADY OWN ALL 3 APPS! My kids (a bubbly 7 year old girl and a very geeky 16 year old boy math wiz) have finished the game and NEED MORE!
replyContent: Thanks Emiliano. We're working on new games as fast as we can. We released one last year, and hopefully a new one end of this year. They will be targetting young kids though. Maybe for your little one :)

content: You deserve five stars for including that feature alone. Colourblind mode next? ;)  Signed, a protanomalous lefty
replyContent: Hei Job, glad you liked the feature. We've been thinking about color blindness, but it's harder to test. As you know, there are various forms of it ! Are you experiencing a particular problem ? We might try having multiple color palettes in the future...

content: I loved DB 5+ and Algebra and was excited for this game, but after two worlds I've run across a problem. I can't click on items sometimes. I really need help, thanks.
replyContent: Hello, can you take contact with our support please ? See http://support.dragonboxapp.com/ Thanks!

content: 5-year-olds love it and the parents freshened up old skills
replyContent: Freshening up is good! Hope you enjoyed time with your little loved ones!

content: Cleverly designed game, teaches geometry, and my kids love it.
replyContent: Hello peter, glad you loved the game! Have you tried our algebra games as well ?

content: This is the rare game that succeeds in being highly educational and truly fun.  They really nail it. The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is that it could really use more levels, especially at the moderate and challenging levels. Just at the point at which my son really seemed to be getting the hang of it, he finished it. That said, it was well worth the money for what he got out of it.
replyContent: Thanks Donovan! We hope one day to be able to add more levels so that our 'great', 'rare', 'highly educational and truly fun' game that is 'well worth the money' gets its 5th star ! ;)

content: But you need to make amother game
replyContent:
Hello Lawrence! Thanks for the feedback! What should we do to earn that 5th star ? :)

And yes, we're working on not just one, but 2 other games. Be sure to check our Facebook page or web site for announcement.

content: Very nice :)
replyContent: Thanks Corneliu! We hope you have fun with your kid(s)!

content: finally i'm glad about technology
Incredible graphics.  Out of this world creativity.  Reminiscent of Ralph Bakshi somehow. . . Absolutely brilliant!! The mathematics is spot on.
replyContent: Thanks Michelle, really appreciated!

content: Brilliant game!
replyContent: Thanks James!

content: Superb
replyContent: Thank Ken!

content: Cool engaging art.  Game mechanism based heavily on geometry so that concepts are reenforced. Love it.  My 8yr old son loved it. Math teacher wife loved it too.
replyContent: Thanks Clint! Feel free to ask your wife to send her some feedback. We love to hear from teachers!

content: Brilliant

We've tried out a lot of educational games with our daughter, and even the best ones tend to just add sound and animation to generic math and spelling problems.  This game and the original DragonBox are the only ones that actually turn math itself into fun, compelling games.  Looking back, it makes so much sense - I enjoyed geometry in school because it was almost like a game to me.  Now I see my daughter getting the same enjoyment from this game.
replyContent: Thanks Jason! We were like you when we were young. We always thought that Math was a game. Some people don't see it that way. We're trying to reveal the gaming part for those who don't see it! All kids like puzzles!

content: Good fun doing geometry proofs.  Instructions could use a little work, though.
replyContent: Thanks Karen! We've made an update to try to make it a bit better to understand the goal. Hope that helps!

content: En apprentissage ou en revision tout la famille a trouve son compte. Marie / maman  . Merci
replyContent: Merci!

content: The reason I got this app was because the Dragon box algebra was awesome. My 5 year old jus knows to solve simple algebra. Unfortunately this app didn't go up to it's potential. Sometimes the app gets frozen and had to be restarted. Also the levels are misleading like you go to next level and it is easier. I would have hoped kids to learn more about how angles of a triangle could make a difference when angles change. Overall ok-good.
replyContent: Hello Ravi! FreezesÂ aren't normal. Do you still have problems with our latest release ? If yes, contact our support. As for difficulty, what's easy for one kid isn't necessarily easy for another kid. But we can guarantee you that the last level is a bit of challenge for a 5yo! I didn't understand your feedback about angles in triangles.

content: Real games teaching real maths, with a beautiful look and feel.
replyContent: Thanks Duncan! Very appreciated!

content: My son loves this game. It's a great puzzle game by every measure! Fun, smart, looks & sounds great.

I bought Dragonbox Algebra and elements. Algebra was incredibly good so I thought elements would be also. It was a let down. the interface is difficult to control. Ive had to restart the app just to get back to the main screen to choose a level. The level choosing is also confusing and misleading plus there is no hints or solution button like in DB algebra. Fix these things and it may have potential. I know the creators of Dragonbox can do better.
replyContent: Hello Kannen, sorry we disappointed you with our first version of Elements. Bear with us! First you will be glad to know we are working on an update to clarify a few things. Second, Elements has an inbuilt help that hints at which rule you should use. We also have video walkthroughs (link from http://wewanttoknow.com/elements/). Thanks again!

content: Another jackpot from Dragonbox
replyContent: Thanks Ole!

content: My kids love it ask for it all the time.  So willing to pay for a good app with no ads or purchases.  Thank you!
It subtly teaches concepts of geometric proofs without a single word. It's so natural.
Wonderful app. Our six year old loves the range. A little less creature collection in this one means its not as played as algebra but still one of his favourites. Recommended.
A fun and intuitive way to learn geometry by experimentation, in a beautifully presented game.
So satisfying.
My daughter is really to small but I enjoyed the game myself.
Well done on another fantastic game. I couldn't put my phone down.
replyContent: Thank you Jonathan. Very appreciated here !

content: Excellent!

I never thought geometry proofs could be fun.  My kids ate up both Dragonbox Algebra apps by the same developers and this app is just as good.  It's more advanced for sure. Geometry is more difficult than beginning Algebra but this app still enables a younger than high school age kid to explore advanced geometry.

I couldn't believe what my eight year old declared,"I love this even more than Dragon Box."  And how is it possible for me to love geometry proofs now?  Even working on my masters in mathematics, I avoid all things geometry and proof related.
this is the best game ever
Good but not what I expect from the makers of dragonbox.
replyContent: Michael, the first DragonBox was launched without side B! We add features based on customer feedback and pedagogical need. Feel free to take contact with our support to discuss this further !

content: I already bought previous version of DragonBox, which is superb. I wish there are more educating and simultaneously entertaining games like this! My kids love it and they're certainly not school enthusiasts. :-) I'm really missing some free trial version of the game (that is why I give 4 stars only). I'm also a little bit afraid about the overall lenght of the game. Also S-Pen is not working with this game on Note3. This is valid also for other DragonBox games, but this game would make a good use of the S-Pen.
replyContent: Hello Alex, WRT to the game length, we're adding a third mode in the coming update, with more levels. Maybe more in the future. As for having free version, putting purchase in apps is against our policy. Still we're very good at refunding unsatisfied customers (at least on Play)! So just try it !

content: This game is both fun and a very clever way to learn geometry. I like the way that you don't realised that you are being tested, as  you progress through the levels. This removes any pressure that kids may get in other learning programs, making it a much more entertaining experience.  Once my 7yo starts elements it is hard to get him off it, he enjoys it so much.  More levels please!  Also could you add a way of seeing a summary of all the powers you currently have,  if I have to help my kids, it is hard to work out what powers they have gained while I wasn't watching.

My 4 year old loves dragonbox 5+ and dragonbox 12+ and finished both in less than a week.   He likes elements but was getting frustrated because he was tracing triangles but it wasn't working. I tried and it didn't work too, but then we got it working without knowing what we did differently.   I had to play the game on my own after bedtime to figure out that the monster horns correspond with the triangle sides.   Really wish there were instructions or examples so the kids could figure it out faster.   Would give it 5 stars if it had instructions.

My five year old son LOVES all your games. Unfortunately, he finished this one in about four days. He was also more of a fan of the three star system from the Dragon box games.  Still great job. How about calculus next?
replyContent: Paul, we would have thought that providing 4 days of enjoyment to your 5 years old son, including solving 20+ steps puzzles using only geometrical proof would have gotten us one more star! Hopefully the update coming out in a few days will make you change your mind! :) As for star system and calculus, it's in the plans. No date yet though!

content: I've played both previous DragonBox games all the way through. I've also had some of my struggling students play them with great success. This game was fun and useful, however there is still a bit of room for improvement. First, it felt a bit short. Next, there was very limited in-game help. I understand that part of the process is figuring things out, but some sort of a hint system like the previous games had would be useful. Finally, there is no 'flip side' like with DBA12+. I'd love a flip side that told me which theorems and postulates I was using. Still, I'd buy it again.
replyContent: Hello, an update is coming soon with some more help and information. Don't forget to revise your review when it's out! Thanks again!

content: This game is truly awesome! It helps almost anyone at any age to understand geometry concepts. Young children do not realize they are mastering the abstract concepts that some high school students struggle to master. Amazing graphics and engaging app design make this something even adults would enjoy doing. As a teacher I would give this to 3rd graders all the way up to high school geometry. If we want students to UNDERSTAND their learning, not just memorize definitions and facts that they can not apply, then this is a must have for everyone!

I love Dragonfly 5+ and 12+, yet have always struggled with algebra. Geometry, on the other hand, was always a source of wonder and joy, so I can not understand why the game makes so little sense to me. There are hardly any instructions, no hints, and, worst of all, no clue as to how the solution is to be achieved. So you accidentally stumble through, happen to solve the example before understanding why, and then have to apply whatever it was you happened to do, if you're lucky enough ro remember.
replyContent: Eirin, thanks for your feedback! Really sorry to disappoint, we put a lot of love in this game, which will improve over time. Today instructions and video walkthrough can be found online (http://wewanttoknow.com/learning-resources/). We're also working on an update with more internal documentation. We really hope this can help you out!
